name: White Bread
author: In Memory of Ella I. Schlosser
instructions: Soften yeast in warm water. Combine sugar, salt, shortening and water. Combine nonfat milk solids and 2 cups flour. Add to the above mixture. Add softened yeast. Beat until smooth. Add remaining flour gradually to make a soft dough. Turn out on a lightly floured pastry cloth and knead until surface of dough is smooth. Place in a greased bowl. Turn once to bring greased side up. Cover. Let rise in a warm place until double in bulk, about 45 minutes. Turn out on a pastry cloth. Knead. Shape into a loaf pan 8 1/2 x 5 x 2 1/2 inches. Cover and let rise until double in bulk, about 30 minutes. Bake in a moderate oven (350Â°) for about 40 minutes.
